column4: to to community college and take DOS 101 to familiarize youself with the concept of working directory
i've learnt all step by step as i was needing it time after time but it can be useful thx for the advice, anyway i always found a solution even if i don't go the faster way
this is NOT your home directory "~/home/jacques"
read me i made a mistake on 1 sentence just because of attention
i know its either /home/jacquesdupontd/ or ~/ i learnt him about the ~/ just upper in the discussino

btw i've seen something im not sure about, before on other version of ubuntu in the terminal when i was typing ~/ + tab then it was putting me the user directory but now you have to directly put the next directory you want to go to, it's pretty much the same but i don't know the explanation of this change
i expressed myself wrongly but that doesn't matter anyway
ls ~/  <TAB>    Display all 197 possibilities? (y or n)
im saying before, you were typing "cd ~/ + tab" and it was becoming "cd /home/userdir/" i know all this command to list folders
do you have integrated intel graphics?

no nvidia and it's working perfectly sometimes during 30 minutes it doesn't matter i just doesn't understand or i understand that the buffer is too big and instead of just needing the speed of downloading it at his time life speed which means not more than 100ko/s at all , do you undersand ?
mess around with the settings in Preferences=>Tools=>Input & Codecs including Cacheing
you need more cacheing... because avi is an uncompressed pig
thx i will need you then, i just think i can do better
